definition: weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Internet era, weaks the restraints of the above factors.
sentences.chinese: 互联网时代的来临，弱化了上述的束缚因素。

sentences.english: The weakening of the diamond tool matrix performance was studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了金刚石工具胎体材料的性能“弱化”问题。

sentences.english: Viewing contact information and tracking ongoing conversations are de-emphasized.
sentences.chinese: 查看联系人信息和跟踪正在进行的会话功能被弱化。

sentences.english: It can also corrode and weaken the shell over time.
sentences.chinese: 而且时间长了也还腐蚀弱化龟壳。

sentences.english: The very fact that ratings can be reduced undermines the basic premise of reliability.
sentences.chinese: 基于破坏可靠真实这一基本前提，评级确实在被弱化。

sentences.english: These essays tended to concentrate on ideological elements while some aesthetic values were undermined.
sentences.chinese: 这一类散文有着思想的偏至和审美的弱化等特点。

sentences.english: Peaceful or not, the future of the region will be one of weakened central authority.
sentences.chinese: 无论和平与否，未来这一地区的中央权威都将弱化。

sentences.english: For weaking the arbitration, two kinds of situations are mainly discussed.
sentences.chinese: 在弱化对仲裁的依赖程度方面，主要讨论了两种情况。
第三点，领导阶层凝聚性的弱化。

sentences.english: Similarly, a rate increase could weaken economic growth further, Silvia says.
sentences.chinese: 同样地，利率提高会弱化经济的进一步增长。

sentences.english: Based on the conclusion, we get several means to solve this problem.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上获得了解决激励弱化问题的若于办法。

sentences.english: It is a non-disputed fact to serious weakness of supervisory authority of the People's Congress.
sentences.chinese: 人大监督功能弱化是不争的事实。

sentences.english: Ming, Grand court in the Central Division of the judicial power of the three gradually weakened.
sentences.chinese: 明末，大理寺在中央司法三司中权力渐弱化。

sentences.english: There are no obvious relationship between weakening of the glottal stop and the length of the tone.
sentences.chinese: 喉塞尾弱化程度与入声时长无明显关系。

sentences.english: But finding counterexamples can, in general, weaken our confidence in our own arguments.
sentences.chinese: 然而找反例往往会弱化我们在争辩时的自信。

sentences.english: The long-term decline in unionization seems irreversible.
sentences.chinese: 从长远看，工会弱化似乎是不可逆的过程。

definition: to water down/to play down/to trivialize/to weaken/to become dull with time/to desalinate/desalination
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
prominent/outstanding/to give prominence to/to protrude/to project
whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
